Reviews.Title: “A good location for a 3-star hotel, but looks like beds need replacing!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewS60
Reviews.Content: I have patronised this hotel several times over the last few years, and had found it a good-value 3-star hotel in a good location. Small rooms, but generally clean and tidy, and I have found the staff generally helpful, breakfast OK and restaurant also OK, serving hearty German food. BUT this time, I hit a big snag. I was given a single room (as booked) on the fourth floor and turned in for a night's sleep. No chance. The bed had seen better days. The mattress was soft and lumpy and the divan base uneven with signs of the springing giving way. The bed hardly looked like it was made to 'hotel specification' - it seemed like a cheap insubstantial domestic bed. I admit I like a firm bed, but this was impossible. Finished up wrapping myself up in the duvet and sleeping on the floor, Japanese style. The next morning, I asked to be moved to another room - and was moved immediately to another similar room -without question. The bed was better and usable, but still rather soft and saggy. I suspect these beds have not been renewed since the last refurbishment some years ago. When I left after my 3-day stay, I pointed out to the receptionist the comments I had made about this problem on the hotel's comment card - she didn't seem too surprised to hear my comments (!), and she told me that some beds have been renewed recently. It would seem the staff know there is a problem. But the management need to get this sorted out. Soon.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: cazjacko
Reviews.Content: we stayed here last month. it was our fourth trip to berlin as we really love the city. i think this has to be the best hotel we have stayed in [in berlin] up to now. friendly staff, clean room, and free hot and cold vast breakfast buffet, which filled us up till lunch. the location is great and easy to find. couldnt fault it. we paid approx £45 a night for two people including breakfast [expedia] bargain!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: kays26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in ideal location for exploring the sights of Berlin. Rooms are small and basic and could do with refurbishment but adequate for a couple of nights, would have liked tea/coffee making facilities. Staff are very helpful, and the food in the restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I have returned”
Reviews.Author: bobmacNewtonMearns
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 11/03/12 until 17/03/12.Usual standard of service...first class.You get what you pay for here.I was particularily impressed with the young staff at breakfast they couldnt do enough.Attached restaurant lovely german food and with the 10% discount for cash couldnt be beaten.Staff all round were first class all found a nice homely feeling.Will keep going back.Last word for the cleaning staff...not in your face...if you dont want to be disturbed thats ok...room kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: silavent
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel,position is perfect,fine rooms,great service,superb breakfast and check out its restaurant.Staff are really helpful,very good English spoken. Close to the U bahn and easy connections to all sites.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheep and friendly”
Reviews.Author: didsbox
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Berlin was almost a month ago, we booked 2 double rooms for 4 people. When we arrived we gound small yet comfortable rooms with great showers and free WiFi all around the hotel. The breakfast buffet was great, with lots of choices. Location is fantastic, only 4 minutes on foot to the Uhlandstr. U-bahn staion, and 10 minutes by train to Alexanderplatz. All in all - we enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: daveandcags
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights , very conveniently located, rooms typical of a city hotel (slightly small), but had everything you needed. Breakfast excellent, hotel staff very friendly and helpful, resturant and bar staff exceptionly hospitible. Would definately recommend this hotel adn will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is a little far from the center”
Reviews.Author: Iwan89
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little far from the center, but fortunately there are good and cheap access the S-Bahn to the center. The hotel is quite nice and well wysposazone rooms as three star hotel and free Internet. In the room but I really missed an extra on the walls, there was a little empty. The room was clean and cleaned daily. Never had any problems with a conversation in English at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Irenedoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 1 night. I chose this hotel after reading all good reviews about it on this site and dont regret about the choice. The hotel is located just off the main shopping street, safe neighborhood, hundred meters away from bus stops that go around the city and to the Tegel airport, the same distance to the excursion bus stop. The staff very helpful, sold ticket for the excursion bus, gave a free ticket for something at a Christmas market (which I didn't use), gave a card for a free drink in the bar, which i also didnt use, gave a map with pointing out central Christmas markets. I had a single room, which was regular small size, just enough for 1 person, everything was clean, shiny. The window faced back side, but to my mind, even facing the front, there isnt much noise. I asked for smoking room, to my surprise, it almost didnt smell like a smoking room. The restaurant of the hotel serves delicious food. Breakfast was choice of 4-5 sausages, fish, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, jams, joghurts, choce of bread, omlet... I am very glad with the hotel, its location, price (45euro incl. breakfast for single room) and the stay. Definately stay here during the next stay in Berlin. Perfect for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Poor sound-proofing equals poor sleep”
Reviews.Author: travelling_is_bliss
Reviews.Content: It's rare for me to write a review while I'm still at the hotel I'm reviewing but I'm making an exception as I'm on my third night in a row of not being able to sleep because there are doors slamming every 10-15 minutes in this place and every footstep in the floor above mine seems to reverberate as a loud thudding noise in my room. Even with earplugs in! Don't know if this is a problem particular to room 322 or not since few other reviews note a noise problem. It has made for a miserable stay, though, and has cast a bit of a pall over my first visit to Berlin as I've felt tired all the time. I don't consider myself a light sleeper and have never had a problem like this on any of my travels before. Maybe it's worse with all the groups of young adults who seem to be here for New Year's and keep popping in and out of each other's rooms. It's a real shame, though, as I wanted to like this hotel. It was super-easy to get to, even late at night, the room was quite spacious for a single and the breakfast was plentiful. The free WiFi was useful, though I've come to realise that when continental hotels boast of satellite or cable tv, that just means they have BBC news. I've tried as a result to be fair in my scoring - except for the internal noise problem, this hotel would have suited me fine. Ultimately, though, if I can't count on getting a good night's sleep, that's a deal-breaker. If I hadn't prepaid, I'd have checked out after the first night. As it is, I wish I'd sucked up the extra cost and stayed somewhere else for my last night so that I could get some rest before my early flight tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with restuarant”
Reviews.Author: AnnH3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Is in a good location just off the main shopping street. Stunning Christmas lights with the whole street lit up. With good access to the Metro and onto other parts of the city. Room at the hotel was on the smaller side, but was clean and kept tidy. When we went to exit the room to go down to breakfast on our first morning there, the cleaner has left two chocolate Santa's outside. It was first week in December and thought that this was a nice touch! The restaurant next to the hotel and is also sort of part of the hotel can not be missed. It gets busy quickly as its ownly small so may be best to book in advanced. We had lovely meal there, had more than enough food for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ilspago
Reviews.Content: Just spent seven days over Christmas and stayed in The Berlin Plaza. Two minutes from The küdamm and the shops, five minutes from the Gedächnis Kirche, Europa centre and the bus terminal. We booked the hotel Over Booking.com. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and good bathroom facilities. Anyway, in Berlin a person just needs aplace to have a good sleep after a hard day shopping,eating and having a Berlin Kindle. The price was 350€ including breakfast would stay there again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Good location, typical German city hotel”
Reviews.Author: LjoJo
Reviews.Content: Very good location only yards from the Kurfürstendamm. Very traditional German city hotel - all clean, well appointed nad good service, but lacking in atmosphere and you have this typical smell of German cleaning products! Good bathorroms - but ask for a room with a tub if you like to soak in - there are not that many of them. Breafst buffet is extensive and good - sometimes difficult to find a table for breakfast, specially around 9 o'clock. Try on of the side rooms. The restaurant (Knese) is actually very good, with typical Berlin waiters - very good at their job, and in a way very service-minded, but sometimes on the border to being rude - at least to those of us used to staying in other German cities! Have stayed here many times and am happy to retrun, but still wait for that first time they have a room available at 9 in the morning after anm early flight into Berlin - I always have to wait till 1500 hrs before I can check in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, clean and functional.”
Reviews.Author: hannibalbrown
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for its price, location and breakfast reviews! Was not disappointed on any count. Solid budget hotel, no frills but very clean, warm and excellent breakfast. A few steps to bus stop for Tegel airport, U Bahn only 100 metres away, and walking distance to S Bahn and trains.

Reviews.Title: “AN AVERAGE BERLIN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: A good average hotel with great location just of Ku'damm. Clean, quiet rooms with a lot international channels on the tv. Breakfast was ok! Internet was way too slow to be able to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Logistical
Reviews.Content: Rooms are fine but nothing special. Bathrooms small. Staff are helpful. Breakfast is good but busy (at peak times) Easy bus ride from Tegal (bus 109) Excellent transport links around the city within easy reach. Some good restaurants in the area. This area not so touristy and is less crowded. Perfect for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Chili4417
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the excellent reviews on TA, however I felt that it had been oversold somewhat when I arrived. The room was very small, and the bathroom tiny (if you stood up from the toilet you were already at the sink, with your right leg against the bathtub!) Having said this it was functional, and for a short stay this really wasn't a problem - the decor was a bit dated but it was clean which is most important. The breakfast was not worth the money, we tried this for one morning and after that opted to eat either at the Starbucks just down the street (yes a sin on holiday but at least the coffee was good!) or once we had ventured out for the day. The staff were very friendly and helpful and there were computers available with internet access that we were able to use for free. Metro stops were nearby, as well as lots of attractions and an excellent Christmas market. Overall this was an excellent location and it was good value, but I dont think it quite lives up to the reviews. I would stay again on a short trip but for anything longer I would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Best Hotel, Best Food.”
Reviews.Author: SeaClubManagement
Reviews.Content: This is not only hotel, this is home away from home, those guys in the Berlin Plaza knows how to treat their guests, the hotel is very clean, well kept, the food in the restaurant is a real German home made food. Location is the best, right on the Kudam next to the Mercedes dealer. Wifi is free, if you didn't bring your laptop from home they have a free computer at the lobby. Rates are very reasonable, service is superb, the atmosphere in the bar is very friendly, the manager mite pass by your table and invite you for a drink, they are very friendly! Good job Berlin Plaza employees, keep doing it and I will always be your guest.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: npkarlsson
Reviews.Content: Small, but well appointed rooms. Everything in the room worked, and it was well cleaned and kept during our stay. Very good breakfast buffet with a good variety of selections. Nice and friendly staff. Location is great for shopping - a nice walk to KaDeWe, and a famous currywurst place on the next block, Ku`damm 195. Also very close to a hop on/hop off sightseeing bus service, a good tip if this is your first stay in Berlin. Easy to reach by S-Bahn from the Hauptbahnhof, exit at Savignyplatz and there's a small ten minute walk straight down the Knesebeckstrasse. The hotel also has a resturant which seemed like a good local Kneipe, with traditional Berlin dishes. Guests get a 10 % discount on food and drinks there, definitely worth a try if you fancy Berlin specialities.

Reviews.Title: “Walue for your money”
Reviews.Author: boundtoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok to stay at when you are visiting Berlin, The prize is right and the breakfast is good. The area around the hotel is were you want to be .

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: eurolady28
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was a mixed bag.....the rooms and elevators are very small, but adequate and the hotel is very centrally located for transportation and certainly for shopping. Breakfast along with the staff was great! However, we found some of the front staff rude at times. I wouldn't rule it out for another stay, but would probably look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, effortless access to anywhere in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Jarimalla
Reviews.Content: Plaza is located ideally along the major shopping and restaurant boulevard of the former West Berlin, Kurfurstendamm. The subway and railway stations are also within few minutes walking distance offering effortless access to anywhere in the city. The breakfast buffet is all about high quality and freshness. Hotel might be a bit pricey, but in my experience it offers a good value compared to other hotels in the area. The restaurant located downstairs is serving local specialities and good german beer and wines and there's price reduction offered for hotel quests. We'll sure keep this one on our short list when selecting Berlin hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good, with some reservations”
Reviews.Author: Catherine T
Reviews.Content: Very good location, at a good price. My single room was a little small, but was cleaned daily. I did not use the restaurant, other than for breakfast. I did not make use of the free internet. I would recommend the hotel, with a couple of reservations. The breakfast room was not big enough, so I was forced to share a table with strangers, and being on my own, I found this rather uncomfortable. On the third day, I skipped breakfast for this reason. In addition, my room was noisy from the downstairs kitchen (some sort of fan?) I complained to reception, and they checked and acknowledged the noise, but said there was nothing they could do, and I was not offered an alternative room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: mikepowie
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Plaza Hotel. We stayed for a week in mid-July, and had done the same last July. The hotel's location is definitely a plus, being close to the Ku'damm and Savignyplatz S-bahn station. The biggest advantage to the hotel is its value. We got an "early bird special", where a double room with a French bed was 58 Euros/night. It has four out of the five things I look for in a hotel: Free Wireless, Minibar with enough room for our own drinks (grocery store across street), a safe and included breakfast. The first three worked great, but I have to say, the breakfast room is often so crowded you can't get a seat without a wait. Food nothing spectacular, but definitely good for an inclusive. The missing item was the lack of air conditioning, which was definitely no problem this year, but quite awful last year when it was 37 C three days straight. One last tip: we asked for a similar room that we got last year--facing the back with a balcony. No view, but much quieter and leaving the balcony door open meant cool evenings and a place to sit an enjoy a Berliner Pilsner each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Johnfris
Reviews.Content: Decent sized rooms, friendly staff and great food. Superb location just 10 minutes from Zoo Station One minor point - Internet times out a lot for bigger downloads, but it is free. Queen sized beds ar average for UK, so we traded up to King Size.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: Jonesyx2
Reviews.Content: Initially finding the hotel proved a bit difficult having got a bus from the airport to Zoo station but, once we were there , everything was smoothly handled and all staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was a bit smaller than we were expecting but was clean - the single quilts on a double bed was a bit weird but not a problem. It would have been nice to have had tea/coffee making facilities in the room and another english speaking channel on the TV other than the BBC World News. Obviously you're not there to watch TV and drink tea in your room so they're really not a massive problem. The breakfast was lovely as was the adjoining pub/resturant which had the added bonus of giving residents 10% discount on all food and drinks. The location once you got your bearings was excellent - we had a great time in Berlin and would recommend this hotel to everyone and hope to go back again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: NOURBod_
Reviews.Content: We got a room (204) facing toward the backyard, it was quiet and nice, and ok curtains. Bathroom was fine. The bed was soft and lumpy, but the receptionist came with two wooden boards and put under the mattress, so it was ok after that. Only I missed a bedside table and a lamp on my side of the bed. The receptionists were very nice, and helpful with information. Only they must know that a good way to travel to Schonefeld Airport is with the tube from Uhlands strasse, and continue from Møckernbrucke to Rudow, and then take the bus from there (in front of the station). The information on internet on the website on how to get to the hotel was not good. Breakfast was good, but boring. The brown bread was horrible. But all in all I really like the hotel, and I recommend it to anyone who want a quite cheap room in a nice hotel in central Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: catchmeifucan1
Reviews.Content: With an unbeatable location just off the Kurfürstendamm boulevard, great little bar & restaurant 24h lobby with smiling staff and the 24h internet cafe, I found the Plaza to be an excellent location for a first time visitor to Berlin. i agree the rooms (and the elevator) are abit small but looking at the price, its always a good feeling when you get more that what youve paid for. Good job guys!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Edwards159
Reviews.Content: Booked online - £120 for 4 nights inluding breakfast - which is excellent value. Arrived in Berlin and the check in was painless, We were allocated a room on the sixth floor which meant using the lift, the lift was very small but acceptable. The room was very clean, and room service/cleaning was daily. The rooms were on the small side but fine for a weekend break in Berlin. The location was excellent- lots of restaurants and jobs in walking distance and also small walking distance to all types of transport. The service at the hotel was mostly friendly, and we recieved lots of travel advice. Overall, enjoyed the stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't book there again”
Reviews.Author: miffy_mad2005
Reviews.Content: Be advised the cobbled road outside the front of the hotel is very busy (there's a pub next door) and the room we were allocated (105) on the first floor was facing the main street and therefore FAR too close to the main road for any peace and quiet. The lack of double glazing throughout the hotel ensures every noise outside is amplified at night. After trying to sleep on the first night for 2 hrs and hearing every car and lorry go by, we'd had enough and went downstairs to ask for another room. We were given a room on the 4th floor facing the rear fo the hotel which was a vast improvement. Despite booking a double room, both comprised of single beds pushed together with single duvets so not ideal for couples. The breakfast was as standard and the service from the front desk and all other staff was friendly and helpful. The front desk being very knowledgeable about the area and restaurants. I would suggest they spend less on single beds and more on double glazing. Wi-fi was free and good reception even on the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Guest since 1999”
Reviews.Author: Dungdang
Reviews.Content: This is my place since 1999. Unless location is not good for the business at hand, or it is full (which happens quite often), I have always stayed here when in Berlin. Love the cleanliness, friendly staff (this is Berlin) and a unhurried breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, lovely breakfast, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BletchleyCat
Reviews.Content: A lovely, inexpensive hotel situated minutes away from the main shopping streets and not far from the Christmas Markets. It's an easy walk from the 100 bus which goes directly to and from the airport. The room was well appointed with free wi-fi internet access, also available via the keyboard and TV in the room. You could also use a pay internet and printer in the reception area on which you could print off return boarding passes for free. The bathroom was well laid out, and the whole place was very clean. The only exception to this was the room carpet which was badly water stained and did not look very salubrious. The breakfast was wonderful, a huge rage of fresh cheeses, meats, breads, boiled and scrambled eggs, bacon etc. It was kept well replenished. There is a restaurant with a limited but extremely tasty menu of traditional German dishes. The only flaw with this hotel was in the welcome we received when we checked in. We were several hours late and very tired due to delays at Heathrow because of the snow. We had walked from the bus stop to the hotel in a snowstorm. We had booked and paid for the hotel via Airmiles and produced the confirmation email to the reception staff. There was also a voucher but we hadn't realised this. The reception manager would not let us check in until we had produced this voucher and we ended up sitting at the internet keyboard reprinting this out before could relax. However after this everything went well.

Reviews.Title: “Exelent location, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: YngveGS
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, only a few meters away from the main shopping and tourist street of Berlin, Kufürstendam. The staff was friendly, even though the transvestite attending the reception area kinda baffeled us. Berlin is a great city, and the hotel was a good choice. We had a good stay, and would definatly concider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Germans know about hospitality!!”
Reviews.Author: thejinas
Reviews.Content: Me & my wife stayed at the Berlin Plaza hotel between 21st to 24th July 2010. I have to say, it's exceeded the expectations we had about this place. We were very pleasantly surprised when we checked in, as the hotel was in a superb location - right in the city. The hotel was surrounded by lots of shops (to suit all tastes), along with various bars and restaurants with various foods, including Chinese, Italian, Spanish, Mexican and (of course) English. There was a nice pub next door (nice Berlin beer) and next to that was a lovely showroom of my favourite cars - Mercedes Benz. The hotel staff were friendly on arrival, although the lady that checked us in really should smile a bit more! The rest were great however, including the Restaurant staff. Breakfast had a really nice & relaxed feeling and the breakfast buffet was nice, with a choice of scrambled or boiled eggs, bacon, various breads, cheese, cold meats, cereals, fruit juice etc. The bedrooms are very clean and comfortable, towels and linen changed daily and plenty of soap & toileteries. There is the facility to watch blockbuster movies on tv (in English) or normal tv (in German). What really surprised me is the free wireless Internet access throughout the hotel. You even get free Internet on your tv with a wireless keyboard provided as standard in your bedroom AND the use of the safety deposit box in your room was also free! The only down side was there was no air conditioning in the room, which became quite unbearable on a hot day (32 degrees). At night it was very warm in the room as well as humid. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would have no problem staying again - just maybe not during warm summer! The hotel has been given a 3 star rating which doesn't do it justice - it should be 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly-positioned hotel which ticks all the boxes!”
Reviews.Author: Amfin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Berlin Plaza for 3 nights at the end of June with my husband and 2 friends. It is in a really good position for using the Tour Bus - the stop is just around the corner - and the trains are nearby as well. The shops in the area are really good with a lot of recognisable names - not just fashion but, for example, china (Villeroy & Bosch), and all you might expect from a capital city. The bar and the restaurant in the hotel are very friendly and welcoming and the food is very good. The hotel is very handy for an assortment of very attractive-looking restaurants. We found the hotel extremely clean everywhere, as has been mentioned by other reviewers. The staff are very helpful and willing to give information and hints about the local area. The breakfasts had plenty of choice and tables were cleared quickly and efficiently to cope with constant arrivals. Our room was at the front of the hotel and was very comfortable. My only gripe is that there is no air-conditioning, and even with the window open it was too hot (the outside temperature during the day had been 30 degrees C and was not cooling down very quickly!). Of course, with the window open the street noise was noticeable - especially on the Saturday night we were there when there was a lot of revellry outside. I would definitely go back to this hotel, but perhaps not during the summertime.

Reviews.Title: “A good value. Location works well.”
Reviews.Author: iloveperutoo
Reviews.Content: This place was a good value for the money. Easy, short walk to public transportation system which was two stops away from "The Ring" which is the train system that circles the whole of Berlin. If you like shopping, this hotel is located in the neighborhood for that with lots of high end shops. Grocery store across the street. The service was good and helpful. They spoke English. Free wifi in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value, Best Location, Very Friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: Browardtraveller
Reviews.Content: This is home away from home! the staff is very friendly, the price is right, the hotel is very clean, and the location is the best!! The employees know you by the name, anything you need they will make sure you get it. They got the best location just on the Kudam next to Mercedes show room. Wifi is available anywhere in the hotel, and if you didn't bring your laptop there is free computer service in the lobby.Their restaurant Knese is a typical German food in very high quality, service is 5 forks. I was and will be in that hotel every March, it fits all my needs for business! Keep doing the good work and thanks to all the Berlin Plaza Hotel staff & Management .

Reviews.Title: “Efficent German Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: matt_williams386
Reviews.Content: This being my first trip to Germany I was very unsure what to expect, the hotel was excellent, very well placed with local bars and resteraunts literally a stones through, bus routes and rail routes around the corner, the staff were welcoming and efficent the rooms were clean and basic, all you could really want for a tour hotel, but one that i would happily come back with my nearest and dearest. If you feel you do not want to explore the night life, the food at the hotel is excellent and with 10% discount for hotel guests you can't really complain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: RTravels143
Reviews.Content: Never been to Germany before, or anywhere in Europe for that matter and wasnt sure how to pick a hotel. We found this one at a good rate and when we got there we were surprised. Very nice, our room had a balcony and it was walking distance to everything. Food was different but a nice pub to grab a drink. We had a great time and would definitely recommend! If we go back, we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A clean and friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: richra
Reviews.Content: The Berlin Plaza Hotel was one of the hotels recommended by the conference organisers. Although small, it is very well run. The staff, both reception and dining room, were friendly and very helpful. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The breakfast menu was good and the dining room was pleasant. I had dinner at the restaraunt one evening and found the food to be good German fare and the experience of dining outdoors very enjoyable. The only drawback was that my room on the 4th floor overlooked the street and was somewhat noisy. The biggest advantage is the fact that this hotel is so close to so many of the attractions in Berlin and very close to both bus and rail stations. The helpful reception staff provided directions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value. Clean Hotel. Ok Location for us.”
Reviews.Author: cara250
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel late so our first choice options were already sold out or to expensive. For some people this location will be great. It's near shopping and the zoo and some nice restaurants. We would rather of been in Prenzlauer Burg but we were still able to hang out there. We had a triple room which was fine but a bit small. The shower was a little cramped. The breakfast was very good and the coffee was great. It seemed like a business hotel. I will probably stay somewhere else when I go back. Overall not a bad option. It was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “a good option”
Reviews.Author: tujee
Reviews.Content: i was a bit reticent about this hotel as it seemed so cheap online - but was very pleasantly surprised. Very efficent staff and a free meal and beer at the attached restuarant. My frined needed to see a doctor whilst we were there, and the hotel staff were very helpful and couldnt have done more. The room was small but very clean as was the bathroom. There was no English langugae tv (if that makes a difference to you) and there is free wifi throughout. A great location meant we could walk pretty much everywhere, but the metro is only 5 minutes away if you need it - its very easy to get about.

Reviews.Title: “lovely local german not international tourist, good food, opt for big bed!”
Reviews.Author: gtreshamcooke
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with German feel and food, no lounge, no English TV, internet fee downstairs in lobby. Beds small so opt for king size which seemed cheaper??!! Parking good at back and also garage parking.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: SteveSmithUSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because I got a great rate online, which came with a free currywurst in the hotel restaurant. Was a little worried when I realized there was no AC in the room. However, even though it was in the upper 70s outside, the room stayed comfortable with the window open. The room was very small, as was expected because of the reviews here and the fact that it's a 3-star in a big European city. However, it was clean and modern and comfortable, and the location was good. Just a few steps from the front door to the Ku-dam with it's multitude of shops, and just a short walk to KaDeWe, Kaiser Wilhelm Church, and Zoo Station. I stayed here only one night, as I was unable to extend for the final night of my trip at the first hotel where I stayed - once I moved, I wished that I had stayed here the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Pawek
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely a good value for money. With an easy access from Tegel Airport (take bus nr 109 and then get off at Bleibtrau) it’s just 1km from Zoo Station and right in the middle of Ku’Damm area. The room (I had a single) is small but has all the functionalities and even a balcony. It was very clean and the breakfast you get included is OK (although don’t expect a “Hilton Breakfast”). Bring your own toiletries as there’s only soap dispenser. The only concern I had is with the housekeeping as they woke me up at 8AM. I can fully recommend this hotel and Ku’Damm is definitely the area to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spencerswood
Reviews.Content: I agree with many of the other reviews - convenient from Tegel airport on the 109 bus (or the faster X9 to Zoo Station, but it's a bit of a walk from there) and close to the S-Bahn station at Savignyplatz where the trains are frequent and fast to the centre. Hotel was clean, rooms a bit small but quite adequate, staff friendly and helpful, breakfast fine - we thought the bar/ restaurant attached to the hotel was good - comparable in price to other better range restaurants nearby, and very good quality. Plenty of other restaurants of all types on the roads around Savignyplatz.. Although it was close to Ku'damm it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: Queenie2008
Reviews.Content: I could pretty much copy the last review (if you're looking by date). We stayed for a long weekend in Nov 09 having booked thru Expedia for £55 per double room per night inc breakfast. We were also given a voucher for a free currywurst&chips in the attached restaurant/bar. Room was comfy - quite small, but fine for a few nights. There were quite a few dark marks around the bottom of the wallpaper - think this is due to the limited space around the bed to manover when there are two of you, otherwise spotless. Shower was great, no problems with water pressure or temperature. Rooms have a minibar of the type that dont auto-charge, so you can put your own drinks in if you want - the mini-bar beers were around 3e, tho other drinks more expensive. Hotel has free WiFi if you have your laptop, or you can pay to access thru your TV/use the PC in reception. TV channels are mostly German, some other European, no English that I noticed - but there is so much to do, who wants to watch tv?!. Breakfast was a fantastic of selection of breads, cheeses, meats, yoghurts, jams and fruit. Also boiled/scrambled egg and german style bacon available if you prefer hot items. Staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely be happy to stay here again, and would recommend to anyone who was looking for budget accomodation - I have paid twice this for similar rooms in London without breakfast. The only reason I didn't give it 5/5 was the combination of small size of room combined with no drinks making facility, either of which would have lifted it from fantastic to perfect.

Reviews.Title: “More plus points than negatives”
Reviews.Author: Sooty99
Reviews.Content: Berlin is a large sprawling city with an excellent public transport system. The location of this hotel is good at Knesebeckstrasse just off the Ku'damm - rail stations at Savignyplatz and Zoobahnhof are 10 and 15 minutes walk. The S-Bahn (railway) and U-Bahn (underground) are excellent and worth geting to know as soon as you arrive. Berlin Welcome Card is good value - 2-day card for 18 euros gives unlimited transport and discounts on many museums and places of interest. We stayed 3 nights at the end of October 2008. Hotel plus points - good range of wholesome breakfast options; good bar attached to hotel; clean rooms - not spacious but big enough; helpful reception staff. Hotel negative points - for rooms at front of hotel some noise from road when room window is open (very little noise when closed); no coffee/tea making facilities in room. We paid £63 per double room per night (Expedia), which included a good breakfast. For a 3-Star hotel this was a good value. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: NewNewPlace
Reviews.Content: This mid-range hotel worked very well for us. First, it's in a great location, on the fabulous Kurfürstendamm shopping street not far from the great KaDeWe department store. It's a one-bus ride from Tegal Airport, and a short walk to Savignyplatz, which offers a variety of restaurants. There are also a handful of good places to eat on the same block as the hotel, including the hotel's own restaurant, which offers local food. The hotel offers some discount packages, and ours included some drinks and a bus tour, and a room charge that was well under what I've paid for much less enjoyable accommodations elsewhere in Europe. I had a few email communications with the front desk when I was planning our trip, and they went well. The room, the breakfast, and the overall appearance of the hotel were just fine (it's not supposed to be a luxury hotel, and it wasn't, but all of our needs were met.) I'd go there again and recommend it as a great base for a tourist visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cheap hotel in best area”
Reviews.Author: alpha333
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Berlin Plaza a few times. The low price and decent facilities (free high speed internet, free and good breakfast buffett, nice service) mean that overall this hotel is worth a short stay and a very good value for money. Now of course it's a 3 star hotel so the rooms are very small and not the most pretty. But it's clean and serves the purpose. Overall a good place for a short and low cost stay in Berlin's best area (right off Kudamm). A huge variety of nice shops, great restaurants, supermarkets etc is right at your door here.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a long weekend!”
Reviews.Author: loveberlin
Reviews.Content: The Plaza Hotel was in a great location. Close to the shops, restaurants and cafes. I travelled with a friend and we felt safe walking back to our hotel at night. The rooms were a good size, but the shower was small. The only problem we encountered was the noise. The street is busy at night and the windows don't block any of the sound. The Hotel has a restaurant, but we didn't eat or drink there because it was really expensive. The room had a mini bar fridge which was perfect for storing drinks. I would stay here again, but I would recommend staying on the 3rd floor or above due to the traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mreogh
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be exactly as advertised. It has a very good location for Western Berlin (note that most of the museums and historical sights are in the Mitte neighborhood, but the public transport links to it are excellent). The room was extremely comfortable, although there was no airconditioning. I was in a quiet room at the back of the hotel and slept with my window open with no problems sound-wise (I'm a light sleeper too.) The breakfast was substantial and the desk staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Anders_7
Reviews.Content: Some friends foound a good rate here and we stayed 3 nights. The hotel has seen better days and would need some refurbishment. The lack of air conditioning was apparent on warm summer night and this was a clear minus. Ok breakfast and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: kev_wootton
Reviews.Content: I stayed as a solo traveler for my three night trip to Berlin. Overall I found the hotel to be adequate for my needs and well located. The Plaza is in the Charlotenberg district of Berlin, part of the old Western area of the city. It is a modern hotel on around 4 floors with a small bar area & restaurant on the ground floor. My room was small looking out of the front of the hotel on to a small side street just of the Ku'Damn, the main shopping district of the city. The size was a bit of an issue, even as a lone occupant and at nights there was quite a lot of street noise, worsened by the fact that you really need your window open to make up for the lack of air conditioning. The location is good, if you intend to shop and for the nearby Tiregarten, less so if you are intending to tour the museums. Most of the sights lie east of the Charloneberg area which is served by a good train network. The hotel is around 5 minutes walk from the closest S Bahn station (overground) and 10 minutes from the closest U Bahn station (underground). There is a good choice of local restaurants of almost any variety & cost and there is a supermarket on the street. Facilities in the hotel are reasonable. Staff are very friendly and helpful and are also able to converse in English if required. The bar is small but reasonably priced. I did not eat in the hotel at nigh but breakfast offered a good choice and service was excellent. I particularly enjoyed the large pot of coffee, served in a thermos, which kept it hot to each table. A couple of minor grumbles,. There was only one pillow in my room and likewise towels just one smallish bath towel and one hand towel was left in the bathroom. All told the Plaza offers good value for money - it is a good hotel, run very efficiently but not really exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “ok but not the plaza”
Reviews.Author: spectator
Reviews.Content: as other reviewers have indicated this is a nice hotel with clean small rooms and good wifi. The breakfast buffet is good but not exceptional. My room was in the front of the hotel which faces a busy noisy street. The weather in Berlin this spring is warm and so are the rooms. The windows open but there is no air conditioning so one can be warm and quiet at night as the windows have excellent sound proofing or comfortable with lots of noise, music, parties rumbling of cars and the garbage truck early in the AM. Neither is a good choice - a better one would an air conditioned place

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, convenient hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Brasilicana
Reviews.Content: I was quite pleased with this hotel. Like one of the other reviewers, I was also impressed that the room was ready when I arrived in the morning. They even left some sugar energy tablet things on the pillow to help get over jet lag. The price was very reasonable and included daily buffet breakfast and wireless internet access. The breakfast had something for everybody (European and American breakfast foods). The staff were very helpful; I needed to print something, and they let me print it for free in their business center. There is a tiny elevator, which is nice if you have a heavy suitcase. They have a decent restaurant just off the lobby, and while they don't do room service (contrary to what the hotel information book in the room says), you can order something and go down to pick it up and take back to your room. One thing I didn't realize until the end of my stay was that there is a grocery store just down the street, so if you don't want to pay minibar charges, you can go buy your own water and snacks. As far as location, this was a nice neighborhood and convenient to the subway, restaurants, shopping, etc. I was a female traveling alone, and I felt perfectly safe walking around there at night. The room was about the normal size for Europe (i.e. small), but very clean and with a window that could open. I didn't hear any noise from outside. The walls are a little thin, though, so if you're a light sleeper, you might want to bring ear plugs to protect you from your neighbor's late-night television, discussions, etc. I stayed there for business and then a few days being a tourist. The only warning I have to offer is if you want to sleep past 8 AM, make sure you hang the "do not disturb" sign on your door. The uber-efficient cleaning staff will attempt multiple times to clean your room if you don't have the sign displayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: KipNYC
Reviews.Content: Perfectly good three-star hotel. Stayed in a single (twin-bed) -- small but clean, bright and modern. Staff was friendly and spoke perfect English. I arrived from a red-eye at 9am and my room was ready, which NEVER happens in Europe. I also brought the wrong adapter and they had dozens to choose from. Free wi-fi in room worked fine except the last morning. Easy 109 bus ride from Tegel airport and just one block from the terminus of the U1 subway (which is a bit run-down but you connect to all the U- and S- lines after a stop or two. Restaurant is fine if a little cramped; some items (e.g., Wienerschnitzel) seemed pricey. Had the Koenigsberger Kloepse (think "Swedish meatballs without the noodles) with potatoes, which was much cheaper and very tasty. Minibar was adequately stocked; I didn't check the prices. Breakfast buffet was adequate, but a bit limited on the hot side (only scrambled & boiled eggs, and bacon). One morning there were no seats and I had to come back later. The cold buffet was fine and about what one expects. It also doesn't open until 0700, which is below-par and a disappointment on my last day when I had an early flight home. There is also a full supermarket right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: northropfrye
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel, and we'd probably stay here again. The room was small, as in most European hotels, but the service and breakfast was good. The location was right near Kurfurstendamm and also close to a U-Bahn station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location!”
Reviews.Author: tallsamoan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit stuck in the 80's in terms of design and room interior but helpful staff and best possible location make up for it. A single room was indeed a single bed, however room had all amenities needed, from a well-stocked mini bar to around 30 TV channels plus pay TV. Depending on the time of the day one had to wait a while for the tiny elevator to come The location is fantastic, 20m off Ku-Damm, the main shopping mile and around 400m away from Europacenter. The breakfast buffet was good as an inclusive breakfast, good range of cold items and breads, hot food was nothing to write home about, though. With full occupancy space in the breakfast room is limited. Be early or come after 9am. Restaurant Knese downstairs & curbside offered excellent German fare in a rustic surrounding. Based on the value, service and location I definitely would come back when visiting Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: osumom311
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel from 17 December until 23 December and really enjoyed our stay. As other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms are very small...but they are nicely organized with a large desk at one end and plenty of room for storing clothing in the wall unit at the other end. Our room was spotlessly clean and the reception staff was friendly and helpful. The bathroom was also very small, but spotlessly clean with a tub/shower combination and plenty of hot water. There is a great little restaurant in the hotel...the Knese Restaurant...which serves excellent traditional german food with friendly and efficient service. You couldn't ask for a better location...this hotel is right off of Ku'Damm and smack in the middle of Berlin's fabulous shopping district and its wonderful restaurants. Although the rooms are very small, everything else about the place (the location, the cleanliness and the staff) earns it an above average rating in my eyes. It truly is a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Born_yesterday
Reviews.Content: One of the best things about this hotel is its location: it is situated in an up-scale part of Berlin. There are many elegant shops nearby, including a Mercedez-Benz exotic car dealership in the same street. There is an interesting museum in the around the corner called "The Story of Berlin." The nearest metro station is only 1 block away. Now about the hotel itself: I stayed in a single room which was rather on the small side, but it was well taken care of. The furniture is not very fancy but it is OK. The linen and towels were of good quality. I had a room facing the street but it was not noisy at all because the street is off a main avenue where most of the traffic flows. Breakfast is included in the price of the room and it was generous and quite good: eggs, cereal, bread, meats, yogurt, etc. Given that it was not overly expensive (70 euros/night) and given its location, this hotel is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TinaLM
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a mix of some very good points and some desperately bad points. I'll start with the good: Good location, helpful friendly staff, very clean, excellent bar/restaurant serving traditional local foods. Bad points: room was the smallest double room we have ever stayed in, with bed pushed up against the wall, very noisey as room overlooked a busy main road and as there was no air con, window had to stay open. Double bed was not quite queen size so this room would be no good if you're tall or a little on the heavy side! As we were in Berlin to sight see, the room did not spoil our trip, but it did absolutley nothing to add to our enjoyment. There are so many good hotels in Berlin, we would not choose this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: butch_wade
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights at the end of July. We got a great deal from Expedia, via a link from tripadvisor. We arrived late, at midnight, due to our flight, but I had phoned the hotel earlier in the day to let them know, and they assurred me it wouldn't be a problem - it wasn't! We took the luggage to the room, then went down to the bar for a couple of drinks, they stay open until 01:00, ideal for us on this occasion! Yes, the bedroom was small, as has been previously reported in other reviews, but it was comfortable and immaculately clean, with great maid service every day. The buffet breakfast was very good, with no sign of anything running out, no matter how busy they were. We found all of the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful. We also like the option of a free left luggage service on the last day, we have been charged for this service in other hotels in the past. The location is superb, just off Ku'Damm, about 2 minutes walk from Uhlandstrasse U station, and 5 mionutes from Savignyplatz S station. There are lots of bars and restaurants close by

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: amynneil
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in May 2007 with my other-half and my parents for three nights. The hotel was good value (paid about £170 per room for three nights), the location is excellent (close to the U-Bahn), the staff were really pleasant and the buffet breakfast was varied and filling! The rooms were quite small, but very clean and comfortable. The only problem was that the maid-service was a little too early for us, but a do-not-disturb sign fixes that. Would definitely recommend a meal in the hotel bar/ restaurant- the food was good, traditional German food and the beer was very refreshing, all for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: magrohma
Reviews.Content: I had an great weekend in the Berlin Plaza Hotel. The Service is excellent, and you feel always to be welcomed. I would stay the next time always in the Berlin Plaza Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay - small & charming”
Reviews.Author: IngridN
Reviews.Content: I visited the Berlin Plaza together with my husband in March.- This hotel is quite different then others I have already been: cozy and charming!- The entrance hall is quite small - gives an informal atmosphere.- The rooms are a bit small, but totally ok for a city hotel - what are you expecting? The most important fact: they (& the bath) are clean - and equipped with all necessary items (tv, minibar, alarm). A good idea is the room safe (get the key at the reception)! Breakfast buffet was great - whole room for non-smokers! Super!!! On our last evening we took our final drink at the restaurant- unfortunately we discovered this too late!!!! Looked like a pub, great atmosphere - but no chance to try the food. The location is right in the city centre - ok, a bit noisy around, but you are IN the city - no long way to travel.- Go to Savignyplatz during the evenings - for dining and drinking perfect! I would definively book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Greatly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: doownelg
Reviews.Content: Havig read previous reviews about this hotel I thought I was on to a good thing unfortunately my husband and I were greatly disappointed and unhappy with this Hotel and believe me my husband is so laid back very little would annoy him but this hotel did.-The front desk staff mornings were very rude and unfriendly.+Night staff complete opposite maybe because they were younger! I booked a double non smoking got twin bed smoking!Corridor outside room reeked of smoke day and night and seeped into room Room very shabby in need of major decoration+Beds very comfortable.Bathroom beyond words so small i kept banging my elbows IT WAS THE TINIEST SPACE I HAVE EVER SEEN we had to keep using towels to dry floor had to dry in bedroom no room in bathroom no bath mat slipped in shower water would be all over thefloor and no toiletries of any sort we had to leave home at 3.30am to get flight by time we got to hotel a shower was needed to freshen up but no soap shower gel I have stayed in hotels all over Europe some a lot cheaper than this and we always had soap and shower gel. Room safe, had to get a key from front desk and sign a form saying we would pay 100euros if key got lost! another 1st but needed a sfe for valuables so what could we do. Breakfast was inc. not very nice not a lot 1st morn even though we were early improved a bit next day. Bar in hotel was handy 1st night my hubby had abeer I asked for coffee told rather rudel;y no machine off even though i could see it was on. Next two nights new staff young man and woman and slightly older man they were a joy helpful and friendly. On 1st floor a lot of noise trolleys wheeled in every morn 6am noise unbelievable hubby thought it was thunder!he would normally hear nothing even if a tank drove through the room so you can imagine how bad it was drilling also but not as bad. Best point which is the reason i gave it 2 is location centre of everything close to restaurant bars shops. Word of warning DONT useTempelhoffer tours left us and others at TV Tower and never came back when i phoned i was told they cancelled bus tours for rest of day and didnt care how we got back I complained next day to ticket seller and got bad english excuse mind you it was ok day before. when selling An aussie tourist told us they had done the same to hin and others the day before so AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oxford_lad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend and two students. The hotel is in a good position near to U- and S-bahn stations, and was in a quiet location. There is some on-going renovation work to the bedrooms, but the work only started at around 8.30am, by which time we were on our way down to the excellent buffet brekafast. The staff were friendly and the rooms clean and comfortable. What more could you ask for at 70 euros a night for a double room with breakfast! Would definitely return to this good hotel and great city of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and a bit run-down”
Reviews.Author: Frederieke
Reviews.Content: I may be too crititical, but I found this hotel quite bad. The rooms are kept clean , but since the hotel is quite old, it doesn't have a very clean look. Staff was not especially friendly, I have seen better. They were not unfriendly either, they just didn't seem to care much. Breakfast was tasteless. But the worst thing was the indoor noise. I had asked for a quiet room. From 8 o' clock on it was just a banging of doors and throwing things around in the hallway. Roomcleaning takes place in as loud a fashion as possible. And since the hotel needs renovation, it all seems to happen right next to you. Another thing is that the cleaning lady just walked into my room on the morning of my last day. She totally ignored the do-not-disturb sign and just walked in immediately after knocking. I was still in bed! That just topped it off. I was so relieved to leave this place.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: peterzan
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Berlin Plaza for years. Used to come with my aged mother. Invite children for breakfast and dinner. Recommend it to friends and aquaintences all the time. Ideally placed for an old Berliner returning to his home town, and who knows his Berlin! . Right by the Kurfuerstendamm, near Zoo station, in a pleasant treelined street, with all Berlin within easy reach. It is the most beautifully run hotel, welcoming, comfortable, intimate, and the rooms are lovely. The cosy 'Knese' restaurant and bar serves typical delicious real Berlin food, goose at Christmas, aparagus in season, soups and salads, and set menu lunches that change daily. Recently a shop within the premises was closed, and there is now a new conference room, which is used as an extension to both the breakfast room - with its excellent morning buffet - and for the 'Knese'. Go to Berlin! Stay at the Plaza! Celebrate in the 'Knese'. Gute Reise!. Auf Wiedersehen!

Reviews.Title: “A for Location”
Reviews.Author: dissolvedgirl
Reviews.Content: The first thing you will like about this hotel is it's location. It's right around the corner of one the most popular avenues in Berlin, the Ku'damm (Kurfurstendam). A short walk from the Uhlandstrasse Ubahn Station for trains that will take you all over Berlin. On the street where the hotel is located, there is an organic supermarket and a regular supermarket. You will not run out of choices when it comes to food. The Ku'damm is lined with good shops and restaurants. It's a good area so it's quite safe to wander around even at night. The room rates are reasonable considering a location. It's a 3 star hotel so the rooms are a bit dated but clean enough to come home to after an action-packed day around town. Breakfast was pretty good and plentiful. And free wifi all over the hotel! There was a bit of a mix up when we checked in and we were short one room. The hotel manager humbly admitted the hotel's mistake and billeted our roomless friends in their partner hotel across the street, a four-star hotel, for the same rate as theirs. Overall, it was a pleasant couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mahaaken
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in late November 2006. Staff was very helpful. Rooms were clean. I was in a triple, and we didn't have a ton of room but it worked out well enough (we were there for six (6) nights). The breakfast bar had plenty to eat. There is also a grocery store just down the street. The food at the restaurant was great - my parents ate there three (3) nights. The bus/subway stations were only a block and half away. My group (seven (7) total) loved it, and we'd go back without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Vacation-surfer
Reviews.Content: Going for an extended week end with good friends to explore Berlin, the choice of Berlin Plaza was just a hit in bull's eye. With the subway station near by the location was an excellent starting point for excursion to see and experience Berlin. Also the variety of restautants just around the corner with friendly environment, good service and not at least very good food made also the evenings perfect for al of us. The hotel has a good ambience with friendly and good service and maybe the best of it all that an excellent breakfast buffet is included in the room rate.. All three couples agreed at time of departure that the hotel had contributed to make the exciting week end in Berlin to a real success.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: Marmalade-Queen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely hotel situated just yards from the main Kurfurstendamm street right in the centre of Berlin. We parked our car in their car park and were able to travel all over the city using the excellent public transport system. The hotel is bright and welcoming with both modern and traditional features. As with all German hotels, it was spotlessly clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. And forget about British city hotel prices (especially London) - I booked online and could hardly believe what a great deal we got. We have stayed at literally hundreds of hotels over the years and I have to say that the buffet breakfasts, served in the lovely light and airy dining room, were the best we have ever had. The choice of bread, rolls, cold meats, cheeses, pates, fresh fruit, yoghurts, fruit juices etc were mind boggling and there were also hot boiled eggs and hot English type breakfast items on offer. We just couldn't believe our luck! It's worth mentioning also that they serve breakfast for absolutely ages (I think it was 7:30 am until 10:00 am) so it never got too crowded. We stayed for six nights and had some evening meals in the rustic German style restaurant and "al fresco" as the weather was so good. The food was great and excellent value - again the service was very friendly and they serve meals until very late. It was our first visit to Berlin since 1985 so of course it had changed a lt since then. Many people think Berlin is a bit of strange place to go on holiday but I can't recommend it highly enough - there is absolutely loads to do and see - we didn't get to everything by any means - travelling on the buses, underground, overground trains, trams and boats is very easy and one of the season tickets for use on all the public transport systems is a must. After leaving Berlin centre we also had a 3 night stay in Potsdam so I'll give that place a plug while I am at it - do go on an open bus tour round there - its well worth it (especially if you get the same guide we had - she was brilliant!). And a tip for any visitors to the Schloss Sanssouci - you don't need to climb up all those steps - you can get a bus from the bus station which drops you off at the top - I found this out the day after we climbed the steps in the blazing sun and 37 degrees temperature!! To finish, I would have no hesitation in recommending the Berlin Plaza Hotel to anyone, and being so in love with Berlin, look forward to a return visit in the not too distant future - we certainly won't be waiting another 21 years anyway!!

Reviews.Title: “cheap and dirty”
Reviews.Author: binos
Reviews.Content: Stayed there because of a businesstrip. Hotel needs some renovating. Rooms are very, very small, there is no place for your suitcase - and kind of dirty. On the backside there is a ventilation, which is noisy the whole night, you cant open your window - ask for a really quiet room. The staff is very friendly. Breakfast is ok, there is a nice choice different things, but since smoking is not prohibited - the smoke is stinking. Would not recommend this hotel, since you can get better ones for a little bit more money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel apart form no A/C”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Temperature was in the low 30's when we were there and it was sweltering in the rooms. Apart form that, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “World Cup Trip”
Reviews.Author: Lenski
Reviews.Content: My three friends and I booked in to this hotel here during the World Cup and at fairly short notice. My usual choice of Berlin hotel in this area is Pension Bregenz but as this was fully booked we decided to use the Berlin Plaza instead. The hotel is in a good area just off the Ku'Damm and was very handy for the great bars and restaurants nearby on Savignyplatz. The room rate was very good (particularly during the World Cup) and the hotel was clean and safe. Breakfast was served on the ground floor and was a very nice buffet affair. The staff were polite, friendly and efficient. I would be happy to recommend this hotel to others wanting good value, reasonably-priced accomodation in the West of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellers_from_oz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Plaza for three nights on our trip to Berlin. It is in an excellent location- this is something to be careful of in Berlin as cheaper places are often too far away. There were a lot of business travellers staying here while we were there, and I think they have a conference room too. Positives: *Just off the Kurfurstendamm (main shopping strip), and about 2 minutes to the nearest U-bahn station. We walked everywhere, but if you don't have a lot of time it's easy to get to places by U-bahn from this hotel. It's not too far to the Europa center (other end of the Kurfurstendamm). *Only about a 5 minute walk to the main train station if you are arriving by train *Nice rooms- a bit small, but functional, with very comfy beds. *Excellent cleaning, our room was always spotless *Friendly staff *Very good breakfast- there is a large variety of breads, drinks, cold meats, cheeses, cereal, yoghurt, fruit, hot food, and so on. The dining room is very comfortable and large. *The bar next door (part of the hotel) does good meals and the staff there are very friendly *Also some other good restaurants nearby. *There are two EasyInternet cafes close by, and there is internet in the hotel lobby too. Not so good: *The bathrooms are quite small. We were very happy with this hotel- we paid about 70 Euro/night which was an excellent price for what you get. I would definitely stay here again if I came back to Berlin, even if we were paying more- I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Berlin Plaza Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Knesebeckstrasse 63 | Kurfuerstendamm, 10719 Berlin, Germany
